info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 1, game 8.

(1, 1).clue: Because it disproportionately affects childless women, it was once known as the "Nun's Disease"

(2, 1).clue: 1977:John Travolta strikes a pose & points his finger to the sky

(3, 1).clue: Strikes,coins in the fountain,sheets to the wind

(4, 1).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew leads a black lab over a small obstacle-course bridge.)  Now in a well-deserved retirement, the heroic black lab Murphy worked to save lives in this state capital in 1995, the event that led to the creation of the Search Dog Foundation

(5, 1).clue: Determined by a coin toss, this Oregon city's name honors the one in Maine

(6, 1).clue: He was the world's No. 1 ranked tennis player for 1999

(2, 2).clue: 1978:Mick, Keith & the boys smile & smirk in wig catalog ads

(3, 2).clue: A marionette,an offer with hidden conditions,a yo-yo

(4, 2).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew, in a yellow hard hat, squats with a search dog in a pile of rubble.)  Part of a disaster search dog's training is to ignore every scent except this

(1, 3).clue: This itchy ailment is also called atopic dermatitis

(2, 3).clue: 1973:Against a black background, a prism bends a beam of light into a colorful spectrum

(4, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew leads a black lab over a moving obstacle-course bridge.)  Trained on moving obstacles, over a quarter of the nation's certified search dog task forces are based in this state due to its frequent earthquakes

(5, 3).clue: Named for an Indian tribe, this Washington city hosted Expo '74

(6, 3).clue: This mythological animal carries Zeus' thunder & lightning

(4, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew unleashes a black lab in the training course.)  The bark alert is one of the tests a dog must pass to be on a search team certified by this Department of Homeland Security agency"Search!""Rrowr rrowr rrowr!"

(5, 4).clue: See this town, see it run along the only road in Hickman County, Tennessee

(1, 5).clue: Doctors use this word, from the Latin for "convenient", for infections striking a weak immune system

(2, 5).clue: 1978:Billy Joel leans against an alley wall holding a trumpet

(4, 5).clue: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew poses near an overturned tanker truck with a search dog, who busies himself sniffing the ground.)  People have about five million of these specialized cells to detect scent; canines like Dawson the search dog have over a hundred million

(5, 5).clue: Popular with shoppers, this Pa. town was named for a tavern that was named after Frederick the Great

(6, 5).clue: To denote excessive politeness, it follows "After you, Alphonse"
(6, 5).correct response: No, Gaston, after you ("After you, Gaston" accepted)
